description.narrative: Child Protection: Increased country capacity and delivery of services to ensure that children's rights to protection from violence, abuse and exploitation are sustained and promoted in earthquake affected areas
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief

title.narrative: Nepal United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Nepal 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Nepal Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child Protection: Increased country capacity and delivery of services to ensure that children’s rights to protection from violence, abuse and exploitation are sustained and promoted in earthquake affected areas

description.narrative: With UNICEF support the national Psychosocial support (PSS) operational guideline was finalized, endorsed by the government and published. UNICEF supported the configuration of Child Protection Information Management System (CPIMS+) in the context of Nepal and this system is currently being piloted. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Children identified as separated or unaccompanied as a result of the earthquake are reunited with their families or placed in proper alternative care

actual.value: 2015:Met. 100% of the identified cases, i.e. 379 (113 unaccompanied and 266 separated) children, out of which 353 were reunified with their families and 26 children placed in alternative care.

title.narrative: People in the severely-affected districts reached by community groups to prevent and address violence, abuse and exploitation, including GBV and trafficking

actual.value: 2015:Met. 161,877 (113% of the target) people in the severely-affected districts reached by community groups to prevent and address violence, abuse and exploitation, including GBV and trafficking. 956 women, girls, boys and men have been prevented from being trafficked.

title.narrative: Children in the severely affected districts received community-based psychosocial support as well as specialized psychosocial service

actual.value: 2015:On-track. 158,478 (96% of the target) parents and children have been provided with psychosocial support including psychosocial first aid (PFA) and focused psychosocial counseling.

title.narrative: Percentage of children and adolescents identified and reported by community child protection structures that are benefiting from services

actual.value: 2017:1,390 cases of children were reported through community-based mechanism (Child Protection Committees) to the District Child Welfare Boards. Children have received case management, referrals, and cash support services. (Percentage based figures are unavailable due to capacity gaps at the DCWB)

title.narrative: Number of children and adolescent (gender disaggregated) benefitting from Government and NGO child and family welfare services in the 14 target districts, handled according to established case management procedure

actual.value: 2017:2,278 vulnerable children received case management services by trained social workers as per case management procedures.

title.narrative: Government Child Protection Information Management System for case management established and functioning

actual.value: 2017:The piloting of child protection case management system/PRIMERO is

title.narrative: Number of people intercepted (women, adolescents and children) and prevented from trafficking

actual.value: 2017:Total 2,447 cases of interception were reported among which were: 828 girls below 18, 85 boys below 18, 1516 women above 18, 18 men above 18
